title: Excalidraw Codebase Tour
description: Learn the monorepo structure and key components of the Excalidraw drawing application
prerequisites: Basic understanding of React and TypeScript

steps.title: Project Overview
steps.description: Welcome to Excalidraw! This is a monorepo built with Yarn workspaces containing the core React component library (packages/), the full web application (excalidraw-app/), integration examples (examples/), developer docs (dev-docs/), and build scripts (scripts/). The library is published as @excalidraw/excalidraw on npm.

interactiveActions.description: Explore the top-level directory layout before diving in

steps.title: Main Library: @excalidraw/excalidraw
steps.description: The heart of the project. This package contains the full editor: actions/ defines every user operation (align, delete, flip, group, etc.), components/ has 150+ React UI components (toolbar, sidebar, color picker, command palette), renderer/ handles canvas drawing, scene/ manages the drawing state, and data/ handles serialization. Note that source files live directly in the package root, not in a src/ subdirectory.

interactiveActions.description: Hover over the actions/ directory to see individual editor actions

steps.title: Element Package: Shape Logic
steps.description: The @excalidraw/element package handles everything about drawing elements: creating new shapes (newElement.ts), hit testing and collision detection (collision.ts), binding arrows to shapes (binding.ts), resizing and transforming (resizeElements.ts, transform.ts), text wrapping and measurement (textWrapping.ts, textMeasurements.ts), and the elbow arrow routing algorithm (elbowArrow.ts).

interactiveActions.description: Click on types.ts to see how elements are defined

steps.title: Supporting Packages
steps.description: Three utility packages round out the core: @excalidraw/math provides geometric primitives (points, lines, curves, polygons, ellipses) used for hit testing and rendering. @excalidraw/common holds shared constants, color utilities, key bindings, and TypeScript utility types. @excalidraw/utils provides export helpers and bounding-box calculations for consumers of the library.

interactiveActions.description: Hover over packages/math to see the geometric primitives

steps.title: Web Application (excalidraw.com)
steps.description: The excalidraw-app/ directory is the full-featured web app that powers excalidraw.com. App.tsx wires together the Excalidraw component with app-specific features. The collab/ directory implements real-time collaboration using WebSockets. The data/ directory handles cloud storage, sharing links, and Firebase integration. The components/ directory adds the app menu, sidebar, welcome screen, and AI features.

interactiveActions.description: Click App.tsx to see how the Excalidraw component is configured

steps.title: Configuration & Tooling
steps.description: The root package.json defines Yarn workspace configuration and shared dev dependencies. vitest.config.mts configures the test runner with path aliases for the internal packages. The project uses TypeScript throughout (tsconfig.json), esbuild for building packages (scripts/buildPackage.js), and Vite for the web app (excalidraw-app/vite.config.mts). Docker support is available via Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml.

interactiveActions.description: Click package.json to see workspace configuration

steps.title: Start Contributing
steps.description: You now know the Excalidraw architecture! To start developing: run 'yarn' to install dependencies, then 'yarn start' to launch the dev server. Use 'yarn test:update' to run tests and 'yarn test:typecheck' for type checking. Package work goes in packages/, app features in excalidraw-app/. Check dev-docs/ for detailed documentation and CONTRIBUTING.md for contribution guidelines.

interactiveActions.description: Explore the codebase freely and start building!
